                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> (Kull) and <foreign lang="ar">نَزَلَ المَكَانَ</foreign> (Msb in art. <foreign lang="ar">حل</foreign>, &amp;c.) <hi rend="ital">He alighted, descended and stopped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sojourned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abode</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lodged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settled, in the place;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">حَلَّ فِيهِ</foreign>. (Kull.) See <foreign lang="ar">حَلَّ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">نَزَلَ لَبَنُ الشَّاةِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The milk of the ewe descended into her udder;</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">she secreted milk</hi>]. (S, K, voce <foreign lang="ar">أَضْرَعَتْ</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">نَزَلَ مَنْزِلَ كَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">It took,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occupied, the place,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became in the position</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition, of such a thing:</hi> see a verse cited voce <foreign lang="ar">أَنْ</foreign>, near the end of the paragraph; and another voce <foreign lang="ar">حَبِيبٌ</foreign>; and see <foreign lang="ar">مَنْزِلَةٌ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">نَزَلْتُ</foreign>, <foreign lang="ar">الوَدِىَ</foreign>, for <foreign lang="ar">فِى الوَادِى</foreign>: see <foreign lang="ar">دَخَلْتُ البَيَتَ</foreign> in art. <foreign lang="ar">دخل</foreign>.    </entryFree>26:Tb2e,<entryFree id="n43923" key="أَنْزَلَتْ" type="main">

                  <hi rend="ital">A word equivalent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">similar, to another word.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  [You say] <foreign lang="ar">يُسْتَعْمَلُ بِمَنْزِلَةِ كَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">It</hi> (a word) <hi rend="ital">is used in the manner of such</hi> [<hi rend="ital">another word</hi>]; generally with respect to government, not necessarily with respect to meaning.                   <hi rend="ital">Who is, in respect to religion and the world, as light to the eye.</hi>
